column2: The Grudgebringers, victors of countless battles and veterans of many campaigns.
Ready your bows! Nock! Mark! Draw! LOOOOOOOSE!!!
Nothing affects morale better than a hot rain of flaming arrows.
When the arrow flies farther, it may kill sooner, which is vital in the Hunt.
If the enemy infantry is near, give 'em a punch.
There are too many of them! Load our mortar with a bunch of dwarven grenades!
This spell creates a frozen shield that protects the chosen friendly regiment from any damage.
A sparkling blade of ice forms in the target's hand, a precise magical weapon.
An unnatural cold invigorates friendly forces, making their movements faster and more accurate.
The sudden frost shakles movements of the target, shattering it's armour and turning it to a crumbly glass
Touch leaves a gleaming frost behind. The air within the immediate area drops to freezing for the duration of the spell
The bond of ice wizard with nature is so powerful, that cold winds hinder enemy movements every time he casts a spell
A rapid snow blizzard emerges in enemy ranks blinding enemy soldiers and interfering their fire.
Sharp icicles spring from the mage's hand in the direction of the target, causing multiple wounds as they pierce and impale their targets.
Channels mighty flows of magic into a howling gale of cold. Anyone between the caster and his target is slashed by wind-whipped ice shards.
With a single breath, the caster blows a freezing gale at anyone in front of him within 48 yards
A swirling flurry of snow and ice rises from the land, freezing and blinding all in its path.

A furious blizzard stirs up around a nearby enemy target, stopping them in their tracks. The troops are temporarily immobilized by the strong winds and biting cold, rendering them unable to move and causing severe damage.
Channels Ice Magic upwards, forming large chunks of ice that fall to the ground with horrifying speed.
When Ice Mage cast a spell the winter itself comes to help him, halving enemy's magic resistance.
Only through training and experience do these men find mastery of mounted combat.
It's as if they were born in the saddle and have never left its embrace.
These weapons are far superior to the mass-produced imperial steel.
After many campaigns in faraway lands, all manner of strange blades are wielded, forged by men, dwarfs and elves.
Good mercenaries train with constant drills and exercises and the Grudgebringer Cavalry even more so under Bernhardt.
It's a truly difficult art to wield a sword and shield from horseback.
These men have no fear, they charge into the thick of battle and doggedly keep on fighting.
Specially crafted to allow for the best protection and manoeuvrability.
Forged by the greatest dwarven smiths.
This one can run at a very high speed.
This one achieved a true mastery in the art of war
The one who reach unachievable mastery is called paragon.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are powerful beings who can decapitate a dragon or plunge a sword into the heart of a gryphon in one mighty strike.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
This one can't be cornered or pinned, he just slips away.
The faith of this one is so strong that protects him from any harm.
Every stroke is precisely made and finds it's mark perfectly.
Rally to my banner, and we shall bathe the plains with the blood of our enemies!
Invoking the Rune of Hearth and Home stirs a Dwarf's pride in his Hold, Clan and Ancestors.
Armour inscribed with the Rune of Oath & Steel will not bend or buckle.
The Dwarfs' natural anti-magic resistance is amplified to dampen the Winds of Magic.
A Runesmith may 'strike the runes' - a metaphor for refusing to let them cool, which reduces their potency.
The fire of a runesmith's forge burn brighter and hotter, it's blessing upon an ally's weapons increase their potency.
The Rune of Wrath&Ruin causes the earth to crack, venting forth fire and sulphur.
The Rune of Striking causes weapon to hit the foe's most vulnerable area with an uncanny precision.
A dwarf, wielding a weapon bearing the Rune of Might can fell a giant.
A weapon with this rune moves to block incoming attacks, making it's wielder extremely hard to hit.
A weapon holding thhis rune almost jumping out of their wielder's hands towards the foe.
This powerful rune protects any ally in range from magic.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures that his followers will remain steadfast against the peril they face.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
Those in command of the ranks will issue their commands with a ferocious bark, expecting instant obedience.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
An omen, a sign - this being knows things and any who follow will share their glory.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
This honourable man inspires all allies around him.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this wardï¿½s bearer.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Grants skill: Darken the Skies!, replaces skill Fire at Will!
Make the tiger leave his forest.
Make the tiger leave his forest.
Till green and inexperienced this one serves for a penny, but at higher levels his service costs much more.
Increases the the unit size of Bernhardt's personal cavalry unit.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.
Nobody can intervene the charge of this men, when they have their target.
The leader calls his allies to the last, decisive battle.
This skill grants the character immunity to fire.

This enchanted horn has the power to panic enemies and calm friendly troops with a single blast. When sounded, all enemy regiments within earshot may flee and all fleeing friendly regiments within range will rally themselves.

This mighty sword has runes inscribed along the blade by a Bright magic Wizard Lord. In hand-to-hand combat the wielder strikes more accurately and ferociously against his enemies. In addition a fireball may be cast from the sword.
This sword is enchanted with the energy of Bright magic. Its magical power may be cast when the wielder is in melee, unleashing a fiery blast which wounds any troops in the vicinity.

This mighty sword channels the energy of Celestial magic through its blade. In hand-to-hand combat a successful strike wounds the enemy automatically, regardless of any armour he may be wearing. When the wielder is in melee it may be cast, summoning multiple lightning bolts from the sky which strike the enemy regiment.

Forged by a great Dwarf runesmith as a gift to the Empire, this sword has powerful Dwarf runes carved upon its blade. The sword strikes with such force it penetrates all armour, and any undead troops hit by the sword suffer twice the normal damage.
The Enchanted Shield provides the bearer's regiment with an extra level of armour. This item can only be utilised by troops who are normally able to use a shield.

The Shield of Ptolos is magically inscribed with a myriad of distracting patterns and designs. The patterns magically distract arrows and bolts, sending them spinning off course. The bearer's regiment will be protected against missiles from bows, crossbows, war engines and so on. Additionally, the shield provides the bearer's regiment with a basic level of armour.

The Spelleater Shield is inscribed with symbols which have the power to absorb enemy magic. Whenever the bearer's regiment is the target of an enemy spell the shield has a good chance of absorbing the magic and channeling its power to any friendly mages. The shield can also negate the effects of enemy magic items. Additionally, the shield provides the bearer's regiment with a basic level of armour.
This magic helmet protects the bearer's regiment from the effects of fire or flame attacks. The magical powers are so effective that almost all such attacks will be ineffective.

This powerful wand channels the energy of the winds of magic, providing the bearer with extra magical powers. Any spell in the bearer's repertoire can be cast for less magic points than it would normally cost, to a minimum of one point.

The banner of Arcane Warding is inscribed with sigils to twist magic aside and deflect it in unpredictable paths. When a hostile spell is cast against a regiment bearing this banner the spell is likely to be either negated or deflected towards the closest enemy regiment.
This hallowed banner has been infused with power and can lash the enemy with bolts of pure energy. It may be cast, unleashing up to six mighty lightning bolts upon enemy troops within range

This powerful banner infuses the bearer's regiment with extra courage, making them braver and more determined. A regiment bearing this banner will never break from hand-to-hand combat and is immune to fear.
These warriors are veterans of the "Shadow of the Horned Rat" campaign. They learned hard how to stop Vermintide and Waagh.
These warriors are veterans of the "Dark Omen" campaign. They know pretty well, that the dead should not disturb the living.
Because you can never have too much.
Where's that powder monkey? Get him up 'ere now!
Many regiments have come and gone but those few that bear the Grudgebringer name have developed a brotherhood like no other.
If death is a reward, I'll take it in gold coin, old friend. The glory we'll leave for others.
I don't give a damn about glory, I do what I must.
